definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: A key part of the program hasbeen to commercialize outstanding health science technologies from themedical colleges.
sentences.chinese: 专业的核心是将医学院校的生命科学技术商品化。

sentences.english: In the context of ethnic tourism, commercialization often has a pejorative connotation.
sentences.chinese: 在民族旅游语境中，商品化经常带有贬义色彩。

sentences.english: However, there are some problems for the commercialization of DMFC.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要达到DMFC的商品化还存在一些问题。

sentences.english: Is commoditisation of mobile services the answer?
sentences.chinese: 移动服务的商品化是否能解决问题？

sentences.english: A design scheme is proposed for commercialization of pipette pullers.
sentences.chinese: 最后提出了拉针器商品化的设计方案。

sentences.english: Freeze-drying is a key technology during the production of starter culture of lactic acid bacteria.
sentences.chinese: 冷冻干燥是生产商品化乳酸菌发酵剂的一项关键技术。

sentences.english: Even in a highly commercialised society, law of value still holds good.
sentences.chinese: 是在高度商品化的社会里，价值规律仍然有效。

sentences.english: The pattern of a money tree offered the condition for its commercialization.
sentences.chinese: 摇钱树的格套化为它的商品化提供了条件。

sentences.english: That means the commoditization of elite class at the business level.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着商品化精英阶层在商务层次。

sentences.english: Ming and Qing Dynasties were important period for the commoditization of agriculture in the south of Shaanxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 明清时期是陕南农业商品化发展的重要时期。

sentences.english: Historical culture has been commercialized in the city, and a tourist economy is under large-scale development.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市把历史文化商品化了，大搞旅游经济。

sentences.english: There has also been a major effort in New Zealand to commercialize the feijoa .
sentences.chinese: 也出现了重大努力，在新西兰商品化美埝。

sentences.english: The investment-management industry may become even more commoditised.
sentences.chinese: 投资管理产业似乎变得更加商品化了。

sentences.english: It is ironic that extreme differentiation results in commoditization.
sentences.chinese: 讽刺的是，极度差异化反而会造成大宗商品化。

sentences.english: Whereas, a great many of problems are involved in merchandising right, and they are complex.
sentences.chinese: 而商品化权所涉及的问题很多，很复杂。

sentences.english: Now, there's an antidote to commoditization, and that is customization.
sentences.chinese: 现在，商品化还有一个解毒剂，那就是个性化。

definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
socialization/to socialize/to fit into society/to train sb for society
